name: Scroll Mummy
description: A medium-sized undead creature wrapped in parchment and inscribed with mystical symbols, the Scroll Mummy has an eerie presence. Its appearance suggests it has absorbed numerous spells, enhancing its foreboding nature.
memorable: The Scroll Mummy can drain spells from its opponents and inscribe them onto its body, turning enemies' magic against them.
goals: To absorb spells from powerful spellcasters and use their magic to enhance its own capabilities.
relations: May serve as guardians for ancient tombs or libraries, often found alongside other undead.
environment: Typically found in ancient ruins, tombs, or places rich in magical history.
strengths: Magic Resistance grants it an advantage against spellcasting, along with immunities to common damage types like fire and necrotic.
weaknesses: Low Dexterity severely impacts its agility, making it poor at dodging physical attacks.
attacks: Utilizes a spell-siphoning fist attack that deals bludgeoning and force damage while potentially stripping spells from casters.
most_powerful_ability: Scroll Body allows it to inscribe and cast spells taken from defeated spellcasters.
skills: Excels in Arcana and History skills, making it knowledgeable in magical lore and events.
additional_information: Immune to conditions like charmed and frightened.
Can cast spells without material components using its innate spellcasting.
Can inflict significant damage through both melee and spellcasting capabilities.
Strong thematic connection to ancient magic and spell lore.
Possesses a unique ability that enhances its versatility in combat.
spellcasting: Innate Spellcasting allows it to cast spells like fire bolt and hold person without needing material components.

creature that turns enemies' spells against them
